subject: RE: [junit] organizing tests, and the setUp() method
msgSnippet: ... It depends on what you are doing in the code. If you can replace a conditional expression by introducing subclasses go ahead. If the difference in the two
messageBody:
> Here I would like to ask a question... Do you think it would be a
> desirable
> design decision to refactor your class(es) to reflect the first method of
> testing? That is have a base class that handles TCP/IP traffic requests
> and
> then two decendents (one that tunnels through SSL and one that doesn't).

It depends on what you are doing in the code. If you can replace a
conditional expression by introducing subclasses go ahead. If the difference in the
two classes is nothing but a constant value which is handed over to another
server object stick to the one-class-design. At least that's what I usually do.

Johannes
